title: Freezepop
text:
{{short description|American synthpop band}} {{About|the band|the food|Freezie}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Freezepop | background = group_or_band | image = | image_size = 350 | landscape = yes | caption = The current Freezepop lineup (left to right): Liz Enthusiasm, Robert John "Bananas" Foster, Sean T. Drinkwater, Christmas Disco-Marie Sagan | origin = [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], U.S. | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Synth-pop]] * [[bitpop]] * [[electronic rock]] * [[electropop]] }} | years_active = 1999–present | label = [[Archenemy Record Company|The Archenemy Record Company]], [[Elefant Records|Elefant]], [[Cordless Recordings|Cordless]], [[Rykodisc]] | associated_acts = [[Symbion Project]], Lifestyle, Karacter | website = {{URL|www.freezepop.net/}} | current_members = [[Liz Enthusiasm]]
[[Sean T. Drinkwater|The Other Sean T. Drinkwater]]
Robert John "Bananas" Foster
Christmas Disco-Marie Sagan | past_members = [[Kasson Crooker]] }} '''Freezepop''' is an American [[electronic music|electronic]] band from [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], United States,{{cite web |last=Damas |first=Jason |url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=freezepop-mn0000181023|pure_url=yes}} |title=Freezepop |publisher=[[AllMusic]]. [[Rovi Corporation]] |access-date=December 10, 2009}} formed in 1999 by [[Liz Enthusiasm]], [[Sean T. Drinkwater]], and The Duke of Pannekoeken (an alias for [[Kasson Crooker]]). Since December 2009, the current lineup includes Enthusiasm, Drinkwater, Robert John "Bananas" Foster, and Christmas Disco-Marie Sagan.{{cite web |url=http://www.myspace.com/freezepop/blog/519845464 |title=a big announcement! |publisher=[[Myspace]] |date=November 25, 2009 |access-date=December 20, 2010}} The band is named after the [[ice pop|frozen snack]], and they have described their music as "sweet and cold and fruity and plastic-y".{{cite web |url=http://www.freezepop.net/oldsite/bios/faq.html |title=faq |publisher=freezepop.net |access-date=October 20, 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161208143204/http://freezepop.net/oldsite/bios/faq.html |archive-date=2016-12-08}} Several of the band's songs have appeared in video games, including the [[Harmonix Music Systems|Harmonix]] titles ''[[Frequency (video game)|Frequency]]'', ''[[Amplitude (2003 video game)|Amplitude]]'', ''[[Karaoke Revolution]]'', ''[[Phase (video game)|Phase]]'', the ''[[Guitar Hero]]'' series, the ''[[Rock Band]]'' series, and Neon FM.{{cite web|url=http://www.side-line.com/news_comments.php?id=142_0_2_5855_C |title=Freezepop track on Sony PlayStation 2 game soundtrack |date=September 5, 2003 |website=Side-line.com|access-date=March 1, 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110716065119/http://www.side-line.com/news_comments.php?id=142_0_2_5855_C |archive-date=July 16, 2011 }}{{cite web |url=http://us.playstation.com/games-and-media/add-ons/rock-band-freezepop-pack-01.html |title=Rock Band Freezepop Pack 01 |publisher=[[PlayStation]]. [[Sony Computer Entertainment]] |access-date=March 1, 2011}}{{cite web |url=http://www.qj.net/psp/homebrew-applications/pspkick-official-soundpack-collection-vol-3-freezepop-attacks.html |title=PSPKick Official Soundpack Collection Vol. 3: Freezepop Attacks! |publisher=QJ.net. Caputo Media |date=July 28, 2006 |access-date=March 1, 2011}} Their music has also been included in ''[[Downhill Domination]]'' and ''[[Dance Dance Revolution Ultramix 3]]''. Freezepop songs continue to appear in certain Harmonix titles. Former member Kasson Crooker currently works as a senior producer at Harmonix. The group is popular with college students in Boston and has become part of the US [[synthpop]] scene. ==Background== Originally, their music was entirely composed on a small portable [[music sequencer|MIDI sequencer]], a [[Yamaha Corporation|Yamaha]] QY70, which has often been mistaken for a [[Game Boy]]. On more recent albums, they have expanded their toolkit due to a lack of variety in the sounds the QY70 provided, but it still remains an important part of the composing process. The release of ''[[Future Future Future Perfect]]'' only features the QY70 in a single song, that being "Pop Music Is Not a Crime". [[File:Freezepop.jpg|thumb|275px|Freezepop performing at the [[Cambridge, Massachusetts|Cambridge]] River Festival on June 18, 2005|left]] In addition to Freezepop, Kasson, who had previously been in fellow [[Boston]] band [[Splashdown (band)|Splashdown]], still records as a solo artist Symbion Project. Drinkwater is also a member of the bands Lifestyle and Karacter, and worked with the band Polystar on their debut album. Enthusiasm appears on the song "Boom Box Chic" by [[Los Angeles]]-based LeMans Electro. In addition to dozens of remixes released over the years, Freezepop released a remix of their song "Shark Attack" done by [[chiptune]] band [[8 Bit Weapon]] in October 2007. The remix was done with a [[Nintendo Entertainment System]] and a [[Commodore 64]] computer. A recurring theme in Freezepop's music is references to science, technology, and mathematics. As examples, the "hi-phive" mix of "Science Genius Girl" features Enthusiasm reciting the first thirty digits of [[golden ratio|Phi]]. Additionally, the "Robotron 2002" "All Your Base Are Belong to Us" remix by DJ Nebula pays homage to the Internet meme [[All your base are belong to us]]. Freezepop was arrested in Canada in November 2006 for trying to enter the country under [[false pretenses]].{{cite web |url=http://www.freezepop.net/oldsite/pix/110906.html |title=Thursday, November 9 |publisher=freezepop.net |date=November 9, 2006 |access-date=December 20, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180726201557/https://www.freezepop.net/oldsite/pix/110906.html |archive-date=2018-07-26}} Harmonix pokes fun at them for this in the loading screens for their songs, in ''[[Rock Band]]'' and ''[[Rock Band 2]]''. On June 4, 2009, it was announced on Freezepop's official website that founding member the Duke of [[Pannekoek]]en (originally the Duke of Candied Apples, as well as the Duke of Belgian Waffles, all three [[pseudonym]]s of Crooker) would be leaving the band. Crooker stated, "My responsibilities at Harmonix making games continue to increase which takes away from my time and energy to compose and go out on the road to play shows."{{cite web |url=http://www.freezepop.net/oldsite/news/archives.html |title=news archives |publisher=freezepop.net |date=June 4, 2009 |access-date=October 20, 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180726201629/http://www.freezepop.net/oldsite/news/archives.html |archive-date=2018-07-26}} He also added that he had plans to focus on his side endeavor Symbion Project while also doing Freezepop remixes in the future. His last show as a member of the band was at the [[Penny Arcade Expo]] 2009 in [[Seattle]] on September 5. On November 25, 2009, the band announced the addition of two new members: Robert John "Bananas" Foster and Christmas Disco-Marie Sagan. On April 25, 2016, the band launched a [[Kickstarter]] [[crowdfunding]] campaign to raise money for a fifth studio album to follow ''Imaginary Friends'' (2010). They posted a video, along with a photo of a [[Royalty payment#Music royalties|royalty check]] of $2.93 that they received for online [[music streaming]] services. The band's initial goal was US $30,000, which was reached in less than 24 hours.{{cite news | url=http://www.vanyaland.com/2016/04/27/receiving-3-royalty-check-online-streams-freezepop-raise-30000-fans-24-hours/ | title=After receiving $3 royalty check for online streams, Freezepop raise $30,000 from fans in 24 hours | last=Marotta | first=Michael | work=Vanyaland | date=April 27, 2016 | access-date=May 2, 2016}} Their next goal of $40,000 was reached, which allowed the band to also release the album on vinyl. More stretch goals have been set for additional content, such as collaborations and a remix album.{{cite web | url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/freezepopband/freezepops-new-album | title=Freezepop's New Album! | author=Freezepop | website=Kickstarter.com | access-date=May 2, 2016}} The album, titled ''Fantasizer'', was released on October 6, 2020. === Soundtrack appearances === Along with bands such as [[The Aquabats]], [[Bad Credit]], and Slowdraw the Hungry Eskimo, their music is featured in the comedy series ''[[Mega64]]'', which also produced the music video for Freezepop's song "[[Brainpower (song)|Brainpower]]".{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uZRzGZL6d70 |title=Mega64: Freezepop "Brainpower" Music Video |publisher=[[YouTube]] |date=March 4, 2008 |access-date=December 20, 2010}} Freezepop's song "Swimming Pool" was featured in the episode "Liquid Heat" in the fifth season of ''[[The L Word]]'', originally aired March 2, 2008. "Frontload" was featured in the final episode of the fourth season of [[MTV]]'s ''[[The Hills (TV series)|The Hills]]'', which originally aired on December 22, 2008. In 2010. their song "Less Talk, More Rokk" was featured in ''The Fourth Panel'', a web TV series from the webcomic ''[[Penny Arcade]]''. ==Critical reception== Freezepop won Best New Band at the 2002 American Synthpop Awards and were semifinalists on [[WBCN (FM)|WBCN]]'s Rumble competition. In early 2006, Freezepop's "Stakeout" won in the Dance/Electronica – Song category at The 5th Annual Independent Music Awards.{{cite web |url=http://www.independentmusicawards.com/ima/artist/past-ima-programs/ |title=Past IMA Programs |publisher=Independent Music Awards |date=September 25, 2009 |access-date=October 20, 2011}} == Band members == === Current === * [[Liz Enthusiasm]] – vocals (1999–present) * [[Sean T. Drinkwater|The Other Sean T. Drinkwater]] – [[synthesizer]]s (1999–present), programming (2009–present) * Robert John "Bananas" Foster – [[keytar]] (2009–present), live "drums" (2009–present) * Christmas Disco-Marie Sagan – synthesizers (2009–present), [[vocoder]] (2009–present){{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/freezepopband/|title=Freezepop|website=Facebook.com|access-date=2016-04-11}} === Past === * [[Kasson Crooker]] (as The Duke of Pannekoeken, The Duke Of Pancakes, and The Duke Of Candied Apples) – programming (1999–2009) ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== * ''[[Freezepop Forever]]'' (2000) * ''[[Fancy Ultra•Fresh]]'' (2004) * ''[[Future Future Future Perfect]]'' (2007) * ''[[Imaginary Friends (Freezepop album)|Imaginary Friends]]'' (2010) * ''Fantasizer'' (2020) ===EPs, remix albums, and compilations=== * ''[[The Orange EP and The Purple EP (Freezepop)|The Orange EP]]'' (EP, 2000, limited edition CD-R) * ''[[The Orange EP and The Purple EP (Freezepop)|The Purple EP]]'' (EP, 2000, limited edition CD-R) * ''[[Fashion Impression Function]]'' (EP, 2001) * ''[[Hi-Five My Remix]]'' (remix, 2003) * ''[[Mini Ultra•Fresh]]'' (remix, 2004, promo only) * ''[[Maxi Ultra•Fresh]]'' (remix, 2005, out-of-print) * ''[[Less Talk More Rokk (The Remixes)|Less Talk More Rokk]]'' (remix EP, 2007, digital-only release) * ''[[Form Activity Motion]]'' (remix EP, 2008, online) * ''The Sexy Sounds Of Freezepop'' (EP, 2008) * ''[[Doppelgänger EP]]'' (EP, 2012, online) * ''Ultra•Spectacular Bonanza'' (compilation, 2014, USB Drive) * ''[[The Covers EP]]'' (EP, 2015, online) * ''[[Phantoms (2015 Freezepop album)|Phantoms]]'' (EP, 2015, online) *''Santasizer'' (EP, 2020, online) ===Singles=== * "Bike Thief" (2003, 12") * "Dancy Ultra•Fresh" (2005, 12") * "The Rokk Suite" (2006, CD single) * Anchor to the World Below (2020, Maxi-Single)[https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08J5WC7VC/ref=dm_ws_sp_ps_dp] {{dead link|date=October 2020}}{{Cite web|url=https://freezepop.bandcamp.com/album/anchor-to-the-world-below-maxi-single|title=Anchor to the World Below (Maxi-Single)|website=Bandcamp|access-date=2021-10-30}} * The Ghost Rejoins the Living (2021, Maxi-Single){{Cite web|url=https://freezepop.bandcamp.com/album/the-ghost-rejoins-the-living-the-maxi-single|title=The Ghost Rejoins the Living (The Maxi-Single)|website=Bandcamp|access-date=2021-10-30}} * Rare Bird (2022, Maxi-Single){{Cite web|url=https://freezepop.bandcamp.com/album/rare-bird-the-maxi-single|title=Rare Bird (The Maxi-Single)|website=Bandcamp|access-date=2022-05-13}} * Babes (2022, Maxi-Single){{Cite web|url=https://freezepop.bandcamp.com/album/babes-the-maxi-single|title=Babes (The Maxi-Single)|website=Bandcamp|access-date=2022-10-14}} ===Remixes by Freezepop=== * "Seven Boom Medley" (Multi-cover) (2004) – "[[Boom Boom (Let's Go Back to My Room)|Boom Boom]]" by Paul Lekakis and "[[Boom, Boom, Boom, Boom!!]]" by [[The Vengaboys]] * "Unicorn" (Killin' Remix) (2004) – by [[Apoptygma Berzerk]] * "Unicorn" (Killin' Club Remix) (2004) – by Apoptygma Berzerk{{Cite web|url=https://www.discogs.com/Apoptygma-Berzerk-Unicorn-The-Harmonizer-DVD/release/261053|title=Apoptygma Berzerk – Unicorn & The Harmonizer DVD|website=Discogs|access-date=2016-04-21}} ===Remixes of Freezepop=== * "Duct Tape My Heart" (Remix) ([[Hyperbubble]], 2005) * "Science Genius Girl" (Robotkid's Lameboy Remix) ([[Robotkid]], 2007) * "Thought Balloon" (Ming & Ping Rethink) ([[Ming and Ping]], 2008) * "Tender Lies" (DECTalk Remix) (Druaga1, 2010){{Citation |title=Computer Sings "Tender Lies" by Freezepop |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Eho0Pb84RmE |language=en
